name: A. Alyona and copybooks
statement:
Little girl Alyona is in a shop to buy some copybooks for school. She
study four subjects so she wants to have equal number of copybooks for
each of the subjects. There are three types of copybookâ€™s packs in the
shop: it is possible to buy one copybook for rubles, a pack of two
copybooks for rubles, and a pack of three copybooks for rubles. Alyona
already has copybooks.What is the minimum amount of rubles she should
pay to buy such number of copybooks that is divisible by ? There are
infinitely many packs of any type in the shop. Alyona can buy packs of
different type in the same purchase.
editorial:
Let - is the smallest non-negative integer such that is a multiple of
4.If is 0, then, obviously, the answer is 0.If is equal to 1, then you
can buy one set of one notebook, you can buy 3 sets of three notebooks,
you can buy 1 set of three notebooks and 1 set of two notebooks. Take
the most optimal response.If equals 2, you can buy 2 sets of one
notebook, 1 set of two notebooks, two sets of three notebooks. Take the
most optimal response.If is equal to 3, you can buy 3 sets of one book,
1 set of single and 1 set of two notebooks, one set of three notebooks.
Take the most optimal response.
